description: Through regular rehearsal and coaching sessions, new or already-formed chamber groups prepare and perform selected literature, and learn about related repertoire while cultivating observation, communication, and leadership skills. Typical ensembles would include instrumentalists and/or vocalists, with three to eight performers, one on a part. Examples are string quarters, brass or woodwind quintets, piano trios, saxophone quartets, and jazz combos. May be repeated. Offered each semester. Prerequisite: permission of instructor.
name: Chamber Music
notes: Students form chamber groups based on approval of music faculty. No set meeting
times. Locations and times of rehearsals, coachings and performances determined
